content_preview.title: Node.js Ships Three Releases in February as SQLite Hits Release Candidate and Native TypeScript Stabilizes
content_preview.summary: Node.js published versions 25.6.0, 25.6.1, and 25.7.0 across February 2026, advancing built-in SQLite to release-candidate status, extending Single Executable Applications to ESM entry points, and adding SIMD-accelerated text encoding.
content_preview.body_excerpt: Node.js closed out February 2026 with three releases on the Current (25.x) branch, each advancing the runtime's ongoing "batteries-included" evolution. editor_notes.source_verification: All 4 sources are the official Node.js blog release notes (nodejs.org) and NodeSource — both primary, authoritative sources for Node.js coverage. No hallucinations detected.
